channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Lawmaker to block Leonen removal by quo warranto
item.author: Delon Porcalla
item.description: Removing Supreme Court Associate Justice Marvic Leonen through quo warranto proceedings is not likely to prosper, a House of Representatives official said, claiming that a repeat of the impeachment case of former chief justice Ma. Lourdes Sereno will not be allowed.

item.title: Senate to extend GAA, Bayanihan for pandemic response
item.author: Paolo Romero
item.description: The Senate is expected to approve this week the extension of the Bayanihan to Recover as One Act, as well as unimplemented provisions of the 2020 General Appropriations Act to enable the government to continue programs to fight the COVID pandemic and address its impact.

item.title: DOH probes health facility for pricey swabs
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: The Department of Health is investigating a health facility for violating the price range set for COVID-19 swab tests, an official said yesterday.

item.title: Duterte OKs pilot testing of face-to-face classes
item.author: Rainier Allan Ronda
item.description: President Duterte and his Cabinet yesterday approved the conduct of a dry run of face-to-face classes in some schools located in areas with low coronavirus risk.

item.title: Business leaders hope for faster vaccine rollout
item.author: Louella Desiderio
item.description: An “accelerated” or early rollout of vaccines for COVID-19 would boost business confidence and promote economic recovery, business group Management Association of the Philippines said yesterday.

item.title: No surge in COVID-19 cases yet, says Palace
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: There is no surge in COVID-19 infections yet in the country, but the public should continue to observe health measures to prevent the spread of the virus, Malacañang said yesterday.

item.title: Congress allots P620 million for cancer assistance fund
item.author: Delon Porcalla
item.description: The bicameral conference committee from the Senate and House of Representatives has allotted about P620 million for the Department of Health cancer assistance fund next year, where indigent patients can avail themselves of medicines and other treatment.

item.title: DOH: Contact tracing set for ‘Simbang Gabi’ attendees
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: As this year’s Simbang Gabi is set to start tomorrow, Health Secretary Francisco Duque III has sought the conduct of contact tracing for those who will attend the dawn masses.

item.title: Duterte public address reset to midweek
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: President Duterte is scheduled to deliver his weekly public address on Wednesday, Malacañang said.

item.title: SWS: 48 percent of Pinoys feel poor
item.author: Helen Flores
item.description: Forty-eight percent or about 12 million Filipino families rate themselves as “poor,” according to a recent survey by the Social Weather Stations.
